title: Comparing and Forming Numbers
description: Practice comparing numbers and forming the greatest or smallest values.

questions.question: Which number is greater: 872349 or 872394?
questions.explanation: 872394 is greater because it has a higher value in the tens place.

questions.question: Which number is the smallest: 90321, 93012, 93201, 92130?
questions.explanation: 90321 is the smallest because it has the lowest value in the ten-thousand place.

questions.question: What is the greatest 4-digit number you can form with the digits 4, 7, 1 and 9?
questions.explanation: Arranging the digits in descending order (9-7-4-1) gives 9741.

questions.question: What is the smallest 6-digit number that can be formed with the digits 6, 0, 2, 4, 8 and 1 (without repetition and not starting with 0)?
questions.explanation: The first digit cannot be 0, so the smallest non-zero digit (1) is placed first, followed by 0 and the remaining digits in ascending order: 102468.

questions.question: Insert the correct symbol (>, <, =) in the blank: 456789 ___ 456798
questions.explanation: 456789 is less than 456798, so the correct symbol is <.

questions.question: Arrange these numbers in ascending order: 67890, 66890, 68960, 69860
questions.explanation: Start from the smallest (66890) and list upward to the largest (69860).

questions.question: Which digit has the highest place value in 372,549?
questions.explanation: 3 is in the hundred-thousands place, giving it the highest place value.

questions.question: What is the next greater 5-digit number after 99876?
What is the predecessor of 10,000?
questions.explanation: The predecessor is one less than the given number: 10,000 – 1 = 9,999.

questions.question: How many digits are there in the largest 7-digit number?
questions.explanation: The largest 7-digit number (9,999,999) contains exactly 7 digits.
